name: Network Stack Simulator
short_description:
This project started in 2007 as a series of senior projects under the supervision of Suradet Jitprapaikulsarn, Lecturer, Dept. of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Naresuan University.

In 2008, the first version was released by Nuttasate Watcharanurak and Kittisak Tunapong. The output from the first version is only through console. Only two protocols, IP and TCP, was implemented.

In 2009, the software was enhanced by Nodthapob Reangnapapol and Chaipat Jaruchart to display output on simple scrollable GUI. Two more protocols, Wi-Fi and Ethernet, are implemented. Two more protocols, UTP and infrared, are partially implemented

In 2010, the software was enhanced by two teams.

    The first team, Munthana Limapirak and Sarawut Sukjai, focused on improving user friendliness. The output is now separated by protocol. The tab interface is partially implemented. Three more protocols, ARP, RARP, and UDP, are implemented.
